content.text: is designed to process old CRIS (Customer Relationship Information System) rebilled adjustments for gas accounts. It performs several operations to update and insert records in various billing tables, ensuring that old CRIS adjustments are correctly transitioned into the new billing system. The procedure checks for unprocessed adjustments, updates account billing records, inserts new records into the
table, and updates the status of processed records.

The procedure involves multiple complex operations, including conditional checks, updates, and inserts across several tables. It also includes business logic that requires understanding of the billing system's data structure and dependencies between tables. The complexity is further increased by the use of multiple joins and the need to maintain data integrity across related tables.

CREATE PROCEDURE [CrisNationalGridWest].[usp_CRIS_ProcessAccountBillingOldCrisRebilledAdjustment]
 	@AuthenticatedUserID int
AS 
Begin 
	
	/*
	0. if current period has been processd, throw error exception
	1. Insert Account Billing Record
	2. Insert Account Billing Cris Gas
	3. update AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid  in AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
	4. Update IsProcess Status in adjustmentCrisGas
	
	Change Date
	20110120	PAH Update account billing and insert ccountBillingCrisGas transactions
					Defer the SET IsProcessed = 'Y' in UPDATE Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
					for IsProcessed = 'N' and AccountBillingSeqid is NOT NULL AND AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid IS NOT null in the rebill 
					section or else all of the  rebills will notr be processed.
	--
	20101103	DHO	NetChanges set to zero for the current period
	20181126    VY add changes for UniqueAccountSeqid
	*/
		
	DECLARE @CurrentBillingPeriod varchar(8)
	DECLARE @CurrentAccountBillingGroupSeqID int
	DECLARE @UtilityCompanySeqID int
	DECLARE @errMessage varchar(1000)
	DECLARE @energySource INT 
	SET @energySource = 5 -- gas
	--
	declare @AccountBillingRowcount int
	declare @AccountBillingSeqidRowcount int
	declare @AccountBillingCrisGasRowcount int
	declare @AccountBillingCrisGasSeqidRowcount int
	declare @AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasRowcount int
	declare @AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasIsProcessedRowcount int 
	declare @BillingAccountBillingUpdateTransactionCount int
	declare @AccountBillingOldCrisRebilledAdjustment int
	
	select TOP 1 @CurrentBillingPeriod =  BillingPeriod,
				 @CurrentAccountBillingGroupSeqID = AccountInvoiceBillingGroup,
				 @UtilityCompanySeqID = UtilityCompanySeqid
	FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas 
	--
	-- Check if there are any old CRIS bills with an account billing row and no account billing cris gas row 
	--
	select	@AccountBillingOldCrisRebilledAdjustment = isnull(count(*) ,0)
	from 
			billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
	where	
			billingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod and
			AccountBillingSeqid is not null and
			AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid is null and
			IsProcessed = 'N'
	print 'Number of Old Cris Bills to be processed: '+str(@AccountBillingOldCrisRebilledAdjustment)
	if (@AccountBillingOldCrisRebilledAdjustment = 0) return 

	
	/******************************************************
	1. Update Old Cris Account Billing Record
			Note:	This is a unique combination where the Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingSeqid is not null
					and the Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid IS NULL. We update the AccountBilling table
					and insert the new cris adjustment into AccountBillingCrisGas.
	*******************************************************/
		
		--RevisedBilledAmount =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.RevisedBilledAmount+Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.DiscountedAmount
		--Note:
		--		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.DiscountedAmount is zero for Con Ed and National Grid West CRIS accounts
		--      Modified 11/26/2018 VY for UniqueAccountSeqID */
		UPDATE  Billing.AccountBilling
		SET     OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.CurrentAccountNumber,
				AccountSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountSeqid,
				UniqueAccountSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.UniqueAccountSeqId, /* added 11/26/2018 for UniqueAccountSeqID */
				LastPeriodModified = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingPeriod,         
				FromDate =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.FromDate, 
				ToDate =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.ToDate, 
				AccountBillingStatus =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingStatus,
				PreviousAccountBillingStatus =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.PreviousAccountBillingStatus, 
				AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod, 
				RevisedBilledAmount =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.RevisedBilledAmount,
				AccountEnergyUsage =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.RevisedTherms, 
				NetEnergyUsageChange =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.NetChangeTherms,
				NetDollarChange = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.NetChangeDollars,
				BillingPeriodDays =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingDays,  
				SplitFiscalYear = dbo.[IsFiscalYearSplit] (Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.FromDate, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.ToDate), -- SplitFiscalYear
				ChargeToFiscalYear = dbo.[CalculateFiscalYearIfSplit] (Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.FromDate, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.ToDate,'T'), --ChargeToFiscalYear 	
				ChargeToPriorFiscalYear = dbo.[CalculateFiscalYearIfSplit] (Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.FromDate, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.ToDate,'F'), -- ChargeToPriorFiscalYear
				LastUpdate = getdate(),
				FireAuditTrigger = 'Y'
		FROM     
				Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas INNER JOIN
				Billing.AccountBilling ON Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingSeqid = Billing.AccountBilling.AccountBillingSeqid AND 
				Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.AccountBilling.UtilityCompanySeqid AND 
				Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.AccountBilling.BillingPeriodRevision INNER JOIN
				Billing.Account ON /* Billing.AccountBilling.AccountSeqid = Billing.Account.AccountSeqid AND */
				Billing.AccountBilling.UniqueAccountSeqID = Billing.Account.UniqueAccountSeqID AND Billing.Account.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' /* added 11/16/2018 for UniqueAccountSeqID */
		WHERE 
				(Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod) AND 
				(Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid IS NULL) 
				AND (Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.IsOldCrisGasAdjustment = 'Y')
		
		set @BillingAccountBillingUpdateTransactionCount = @@rowcount
		print 'Update Old Cris Account Billing Record: '+str(@BillingAccountBillingUpdateTransactionCount)
	
    --
	/******************************
	2. Insert Account Billing Cris Gas
			Note:	This is a unique combination where the Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingSeqid is not null
					and the Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid IS NULL. We update the AccountBilling table
					and insert the new cris adjustment into AccountBillingCrisGas.
	********************************/
	INSERT INTO [Billing].[AccountBillingCrisGas]
           ([AccountBillingSeqid]
		   ,[UniqueAccountSeqId] /* added on 12/19/2019 */
           ,[AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasSeqid]
           ,[UtilityCompanySeqid]
           ,[AccountInvoiceBillingGroup]
           ,[BillingPeriod]
           ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
           ,[LastPeriodModified]
           ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
           ,[MeterReadWorkDay]
           ,[SpecialLedgerAccountNUmber]
           ,[GasRateCode]
           ,[BillFrequency]
           ,[EstimatedOrActualBillingCode]
           ,[TotalNetPaidAdjustmentCalc]
           ,[AccountArrears]
           ,[TerminationBalance]
           ,[TotalPaymentsPosted]
           ,[DateLastPayment]
           ,[MiscellaneousChargeAmount]
           ,[MiscellaneousChargeType]
           ,[BillRenderDate]
           ,[BillingDays]
           ,[BilledCCF]
           ,[ThermFactor]
           ,[BilledTherms]
           ,[NumberOfMeters]
           ,[CommodityChargeAmount]
           ,[DeliveryChargeAmount]
           ,[MTACommodityTax]
           ,[MTADeliveryTax]
           ,[SalesTax]
           ,[SystemBenefitsCharge]
           ,[RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge]
           ,[DeliveryRateSurcharge]
           ,[RealTimeNormalizationCharge]
           ,[LatePaymentCharge]
           ,[PaperBillCharge]
           ,[FireAuditTrigger]
           ,[Notes]
           ,[AuthenticatedUserID]
           ,[DateAdded]
           ,[LastUpdate]
           ,MiscellaneousCreditAmount
           ,MiscellaneousCreditType
           ,OriginalGasChargeAmount
           ,RevisedGasChargeAmount)
     SELECT 
            AccountBillingSeqid AS AccountBillingSeqid
		   ,UniqueAccountSeqid /* added on 12/19/2018 */
           ,AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasSeqid AS AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasSeqid
           ,UtilityCompanySeqid AS UtilityCompanySeqid
           ,AccountInvoiceBillingGroup AS AccountInvoiceBillingGroup
           ,BillingPeriodRevision AS BillingPeriod
           ,BillingPeriodRevision AS BillingPeriodRevision
           ,@CurrentBillingPeriod AS LastPeriodModified
           ,CurrentAccountNumber AS OriginalAccountNumber
           ,MeterReadWorkDay AS MeterReadWorkDay
           ,SpecialLedgerAccountNUmber AS SpecialLedgerAccountNUmber
           ,GasRateCode
           ,BillFrequency
           ,EstimatedOrActualBillingCode
           ,TotalNetPaidAdjustmentCalc AS TotalNetPaidAdjustmentCalc
           ,AccountArrears
           ,TerminationBalance
           ,TotalPaymentsPosted
           ,DateLastPayment
           ,MiscellaneousChargeAmount
           ,MiscellaneousChargeType
           ,BillRenderDate
           ,BillingDays
           ,RevisedCCF
           ,ThermFactor
           ,RevisedTherms
           ,NumberOfMeters
           ,CommodityChargeAmount
           ,DeliveryChargeAmount
           ,MTACommodityTax
           ,MTADeliveryTax
           ,SalesTax
           ,SystemBenefitsCharge
           ,RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge
           ,DeliveryRateSurcharge
           ,RealTimeNormalizationCharge
           ,LatePaymentCharge
           ,PaperBillCharge
           ,'N' AS [FireAuditTrigger]
           ,Notes
           ,@AuthenticatedUserID
           ,GETDATE()
           ,GETDATE()
           ,MiscellaneousCreditAmount
           ,MiscellaneousCreditType
           ,GasChargeAmount as OriginalGasChargeAmount
           ,GasChargeAmount as RevisedGasChargeAmount
                      
    from
	billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
	WHERE 
	AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid IS null and
	AccountBillingSeqid is not null AND 
	BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod and
	IsOldCrisGasAdjustment = 'Y'

    --
	set @AccountBillingCrisGasRowcount = @@ROWCOUNT
	print 'Old Cris AccountBillingCrisGas Row count: '+str(@AccountBillingCrisGasRowcount)


	/******************************
	3. update AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid in AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
			Note:	At this point, CRIS has a correct combination of the AccountBilling and AccountBillingCrisGas row combination in the billing
					and the Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas has the updated AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid and the IsProcessed='Y'.
	********************************/
	UPDATE abacg
    SET 
		abacg.AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid = abcg.AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid,
		IsProcessed='Y'
	from 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas AS abacg
			INNER JOIN Billing.AccountBillingCrisGas AS abcg
			ON 	abacg.UtilityCompanySeqid = abcg.UtilityCompanySeqid AND 
			abacg.AccountInvoiceBillingGroup = abcg.AccountInvoiceBillingGroup AND 
			abacg.BillingPeriodRevision = abcg.BillingPeriodRevision
	WHERE 
			abacg.AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid IS null AND 
			abcg.AccountBillingSeqid = abacg.AccountBillingSeqid and
			abacg.BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod and
			abacg.IsOldCrisGasAdjustment = 'Y'
			
	/******************************
	4. Update IsProcess Status in adjustmentCrisGas
			Note:	Finally, we null the AccountBillingSeqid in the Billing.AccountBillingGas to orphan gas and associate it with the AccountBillingCrisGas row.
					Updating the notes to identify 'Old Cris transitioned into New Cris billing subsystem.  This is an orpahned row'.  This eliminates double linkages.
	******************************/
	UPDATE    Billing.AccountBillingGas
	SET              
	AccountBillingSeqid =null, 
	NewCrisAccountAdjustment ='Y', 
	NewCrisAccountAdjustmentPeriod =Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingPeriod, 
	FireAuditTrigger = 'Y',
	Notes = 'Old Cris transitioned into New Cris billing subsystem.  This is an orpahned row'
	FROM    
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas INNER JOIN
			Billing.AccountBillingGas ON Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingGasSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingGas.AccountBillingGasSeqid AND
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingGas.AccountBillingSeqid INNER JOIN
			Billing.AccountBillingCrisGas ON 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingCrisGas.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasSeqid
			AND Billing.AccountBillingGas.AccountBillingSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingCrisGas.AccountBillingSeqid
	WHERE    
			(Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingPeriod = '201011') AND 
			(Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.IsOldCrisGasAdjustment = 'Y') AND 
			(Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.IsProcessed = 'Y') AND 
			(Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid IS NOT NULL)End
